abstract.p: Correction to June 11 obituary about philosopher Richard Rorty concerns source of quotation

block.p: An obituary on Monday about the philosopher Richard Rorty misidentified the source of the quotation, ''There is no basis for deciding what counts as knowledge and truth other than what one's peers will let one get away with in the open exchange of claims, counterclaims and reasons.'' It was from Charles Guignon and David R. Hiley in the introduction to the book ''Richard Rorty,'' which they edited; it was not from Mr. Rorty.
